forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy. Low around 50, with temperatures rising to around 52 overnight. South southeast wind 7 to 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. South southwest wind around 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the darkness of the early morning settles over Downtown San Francisco, a gentle rain begins to mingle with the cool air, creating an atmosphere thick with the scent of damp earth. The clouds hang low, promising an evening where visibility is limited and the city's vibrant lights shimmer through a veil of moisture. The forecast hints at a chilly outing ahead, with temperatures hovering just above fifty; the kind of night that calls for a cozy sweater layered beneath a water-resistant jacket. 

Thursday is set to unfold under a stubborn blanket of clouds, with rain continuing its steady rhythm. As the day progresses, the temperature will dip slightly, lending that invigorating chill that makes hot coffee feel all the more comforting. With the chance of rain at an impressive eighty percent, prudence suggests considering indoor pursuits: a visit to a favorite café or an art gallery might provide a delightful shelter from the persistent drizzle. Should you be so inclined, a stroll along the waterfront may invigorate the soul, though one might want to don waterproof footwear to sidestep the wet pavements. As San Francisco weather is prone to atmospheric shifts, a casual exploration of what the city offers—perhaps a locally cherished bookstore or an intimate theater—could reveal hidden gems amid the relentless rain.
